page.title: 10THE DAY OF A FAIR OAK FARMER
page.content: Hall Lands Farm,Fair Oak which is 250 acres and has been run as a family farm since 1919 is now being farmed by the third generation of the Emery family. It is a dairy farm with 150 Friesian cows and 130 young stock. Day starts at 5.30a.m. to milk cows in an abreast parlour,10 at a time , taking two and a half hours. Then they are turned out to grass and then it is breakfast. After this the parlour, yard and milking equipment is cleaned. The Milk Bulk Tank collects milk at 9a.m. In summer there is silage making, hay making, straw baling and moving electric fences for strip grazing as well as fertilising and many other farm duties. Afternoon milking is at 4p.m. In winter all animals are housed and have to be fed and watered.
